recipe.title: How to Make Gyoza
recipe.intro: Gyoza are small Japanese dumplings. They have meat and vegetables inside.
recipe.ingredients: ground pork, cabbage, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, pepper, gyoza wrappers, water, vegetable oil
steps: **Cut** the cabbage into very small pieces.
**Mix** the pork, cabbage, garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sesame oil, salt, and pepper in a big bowl.
**Put** a little meat on each gyoza wrapper.
**Fold** the wrapper in half and press the edges together.
**Heat** oil in a pan and put the gyoza in the pan.
**Add** a little water, cover the pan, and cook for five minutes. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I went to Ocean Breeze Dumpling Cafe last Sunday. It was near Manly Beach. I sat on the terrace and saw the beautiful ocean. The wind was warm and nice. I ate gyoza and they were very good. The skin was crispy and the meat was juicy. Pink and yellow flowers were on the table. It was a very cozy and happy place.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Hi Emma! I will make gyoza tonight. Do you want to help me?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Sure! I love gyoza. What do we need?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: We need pork, cabbage, garlic, and gyoza wrappers.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: OK. I can cut the cabbage. How small?

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Got it! What do you do next?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: I mix the pork and vegetables together.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Can I try to fold one?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Of course! Put a little meat here. Then fold it like this.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Oh, it is not easy! But it is fun.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: You are good at it! Now I will cook them in the pan.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Wow, they smell so good! Can I eat one now?
